Subsection.Text: A court of this state which does not have jurisdiction to modify a child custody determination may issue a temporary order enforcing:

Paragraph.Text: A visitation schedule made by a court of another state; or
The visitation provisions of a child custody determination of another state which does not provide for a specific visitation schedule.

Subsection.Text: If a court of this state makes an order under paragraph (1)(b), it shall specify in the order a period that it considers adequate to allow the petitioner to obtain an order from a court having jurisdiction under the criteria specified in ss. 61.514-61.523. The order remains in effect until an order is obtained from the other court or the period expires.
